Detailed Description

Abstract Task interface. This interface is common to all objects that will implement something similar to a task, i.e. anything that can be scheduled by a kernel. For example, both Task and Server implement this interface.

Therefore, this interface defines all methods that are essential for a kernel to schedule a task.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void activate ( )
pure virtual

Activates the task. Different from calling onArrival, because this should post a event, rather than directly calling the function.

Implemented in Task, and Server.

virtual void deschedule ( )
pure virtual

Called when the task is preempted.

Implemented in Task, and Server.

virtual void refreshExec ( double  oldSpeed,
double  newSpeed 
)
pure virtual

It refreshes the state of the executing task when a change of the CPU speed occurs.

Implemented in Task, and Server.

virtual void schedule ( )
pure virtual

Called when the task is scheduled to execute.

Implemented in Task, and Server.
